item.title: (Locally Engaged) Finance and Program Coordinator
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Background:

DFAT’s new investment in vocational skills is designed to help close the gap between industry demand for, and Solomon Islands' supply of skilled labour. The Skills for Economic Growth program aims to shift Solomon Islands’ current technical vocational training system from a postcolonial supply driven model to a suite of demand driven training that meets the needs of industry and fills critical skills shortages. The program will include support to the Ministry for Education to develop a new national qualifications framework and a gradual shift to competency based training. There will be tangible investments in developing the quality of courses in high need areas such as in construction, trades, tourism, and early childhood. As well as working in the formal employment sector, there will also be a focus on linking short courses to small business development in the informal economy.

Objectives of the role:

Assist in the financial management and program coordination of an Australian Government program of assistance for the Solomon Islands TVET sector. The role includes human resource management and communications responsibilities.

Length of the project: 48 Months Start Date: October 2015

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Degree qualification in accounting/finance/program management or other relevant discipline.
  • Experience in education and training programs in developing country contexts, preferably in the Pacific.
  • Experience in working in development programs and supporting high level financial and technical reporting documentation to donor and government agencies.
  • Experience in managing budgets in line with contractual and corporate requirements.
  • Experience in providing administrative, logistical and technical support to consultants who are providing technical assistance services.
  • Demonstrated competency in the use of MS Word, MS Program, MS Excel, email and the Internet.

  • Experience in working in Solomon Islands.
  • Working knowledge of Solomon Islands Pijin.
